title: Billy Crystal, 71, films stunt with cyclist during location shoot for new comedy Here Today
text:
He's been a star of stage and screen for more than four decades.

And at 71, Billy Crystal is still making people laugh.

The actor, writer and comedian was spotted filming his latest movie Here Today on the streets of New York City on Monday.

Working: Billy Crystal was spotted filming his new big screen comedy Here Today on location in Brooklyn, New York, on Monday

Here Today is billed as a May-December romantic comedy in which Crystal, a veteran comedy writer, becomes friends with a younger street singer played by Tiffany Haddish.

The two form an unlikely yet hilarious and touching friendship that redefines the meaning of love and trust.

On Monday, Crystal filmed a scene in which he is almost knocked over by a delivery guy on a bicycle.

Stunt: Crystal, 71, had a close encounter with a delivery guy on a bicycle in the action scene

Close call: Crystal is seen standing on a corner wearing jeans, a wool coat jacket over a sweater and a flat cap. He is carrying a large satchel as the bike comes out of nowhere

Dodged a bullet: The cyclist loses control of the bike and crashes to the ground at the actor's feet

Crystal is seen standing on a corner wearing jeans, a wool coat jacket over a sweater and a flat cap.

He is carrying a large satchel.

Out of nowhere a cyclist hurtles towards him before losing control of the bike and crashing to the ground at the startled actor's feet.

The scene involving a stuntman was shot on a street in Downtown Brooklyn.

Also starring in the movie with Crystal and Haddish are Penn Badgley, Anna Deavere Smith and Nyambi Nyambi.
